Package C482

Class DataValidation

  • java.lang.Object
    • C482.DataValidation
  • public class DataValidation
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class contains warning, alert, and confirmation methods for errors and validation in the other classes
    Author:
    Patrick Denney

      static boolean confirmDelete​(java.lang.String message)
      Confirms user wants to delete item
      static boolean confirmRemoveAssociatedPart​(java.lang.String message1, java.lang.String message2)
      confirms that user wants to remove an associated part from a product
      static void invalidNameAlert​(java.lang.String message)  
      static void invalidNumberAlert​(java.lang.String message)  
      static void invNotBetweenMinMaxAlert()
      Alerts user that the inventory value is not between the min and max values
      static void maxLessThanMin()
      warns user that max value is below min value
      static void partOrProductNotFound​(java.lang.String message)
      warns user that no item of the type passed in was found in the search
      static void pleaseMakeASelection​(java.lang.String message)
      warns user that they did not make a selection when trying to modify a part or product
      static void prodHasAssociatedPartsAlert()
      warns user that the product they are trying to delete has associated parts, and that they need to be removed prior to deleting the product in question
      static void prodPriceBelowSumOfPartsPricesAlert()
      Warns user that the product price is not equal or more than the sum total if it's associated parts

        Confirms user wants to delete item
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • prodHasAssociatedPartsAlert

        public static void prodHasAssociatedPartsAlert()
        warns user that the product they are trying to delete has associated parts, and that they need to be removed prior to deleting the product in question

      • confirmRemoveAssociatedPart

        public static boolean confirmRemoveAssociatedPart​(java.lang.String message1,
                                                  java.lang.String message2)
        confirms that user wants to remove an associated part from a product
        Parameters:
        message1 - associated part to remove
        message2 - product that part is being removed from
        Returns:
        true is user confirms they want to remove part, false if they hit cancel.
